text: li dong Yi from north east China's Liang
in province has been solving Rubik's
cubes for over 4 years now and he's fast
very fast in fact the nine-year-old has
set a new speed cubing world record for
his age group clocking in at eleven
point eight four seconds in a world cube
Association tournament in the provincial
capital his father and mentor Li Ming
gene a speed solver himself
recalls the moment his son beat him for
the first time he there's the back at
home I had never lost my son at the time
we hit the arena together he triumphed
over me place third in 2010 at the age
of seven sign me up
the boy has competed in more than two
dozen contests and is now a star at his
school teaching classmates techniques
for solving the classic puzzle and as
for the theory I know Kyle off on the
pop I use hangouts it's like building a
multi-storied house floor by floor
toward the top there are many formulas
and solving the cube once you've learned
them and with extra skills you can get
all six sides right about newly-married
off via rubik's cubes are one of the
world's best-selling toys with over 350
million sold since its 1980 launch
Shareen Alma Haas BBC News
